address.street: Charge Pond, Myles Standish State Forest

title: Introduction to Bicycle Racing
description: This 4 week program will introduce you to the exciting world of bicycle road racing, and will prepare you to enter and be competitive in your first race.
course: The 3 hour road sessions will take place in the grounds of Devens, MA.

title: Myles Standish State Forest Road Race
Rocky Woods Lung Challenge
description: The return of the Rocky Woods Lung Opener Mountain Bike Race from the 1990’s was a long time coming but is now back as a fundraiser for the American Lung Association.
course: The 5.1 mile course is a loop with mostly technical single track and some double track sections to allow for passing. The terrain has some rocky sections, as the name implies, and has some rolling hills.
registration: One-day license available for Cat. 2 and 3 riders. Cat. 1 riders must hold a Annual USAC License.
notes: Day of race registration is $35. Number pick-up and reg. open at 8:30 in the Bennett School Cafe.
directions: Bennett School, 47 N. Walker St., Taunton, MA 02780

title: Christina Clarke Genco Foundation Mother's Day Memorial Ride
The Best Buddies Challenge - Hyannisport
description: The Best Buddies Challenge Hyannisport is charity fun ride with three starting locations; Boston, MA; Carver, MA and Sandwich MA. Rides are 100M, 50M and 20M. All proceed benefit Best Buddies International
course: There are three route choices; 100, 50 and 20 miles
directions: To JFK Library 100M start; take RT93 to Morrissey Blvd follow signs to JFK Library. To CVS Carver, 50M start, take RT3 to RT 44W to RT58S, start in 1/4 mile on right; To CVS, Sandwich, 20M start, take RT3 to Sagamore Bridge to RT6, take exit 1, turn right at bottom of exit to RT6A, follow 2 miles to start on left.

title: CYCLE Kids
description: Charity Bike Ride to support CYCLE Kids- a non-profit based in Cambridge, MA that promotes healthy lifestyle choices by introducing kids to the joy of bicycling and educating them about bike safety and nutrition.
course: 63 miles, 36 miles, 20 miles, and 5 mile routes through the suburbs of Massachusetts ending at the deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln, MA.

title: B2VT Ride
description: As we embark upon the 14th annual edition of the ride formerly known as the B2B, we have made a couple of  changes to make the ride even more epic. There is a new name (B2VT), to better reflect the new starting point and new finishing venue. The course has been altered slightly to accommodate but still contains most of the same B2B course. The ride is 132 miles long from Bedford, MA to Ludlow, VT
course: A course map can be found here http://b2vtride.com/the-course/course-map/
registration:
Riders can register on Bike Reg at 
https://www.bikereg.com/22401
directions: Athletes will start at One Patriots Park in Bedford, MA

title: 19th Annual Hodges Village Dam MTB Race
Jeremy Powers JAM Fund Grand Fundo
16th Annual NCC Tour of the Hilltowns
description: The 16th Annual NCC Tour of the Hilltowns road race will take place on Saturday, July 26, 2014. This classic race is a highlight of the 2014 season as it again challenges riders with high intensity climbing against backdrops of unrelenting hill town beauty. The race is produced by the Northampton Cycling Club.

title: Fidelity Investments Gran Prix of Beverly
Big Elm Brewing Cyclocross Challenge
description: Big Elm Brewing Cyclocross Challenge on the slopes of Ski Biutternut in Great Barrington, MA
notes: Additional races $10 each. No late registration fee.
directions:
Directions
Springfield 1 hour (49 mi) I90 W to Exit 2 Lee, MA; Rt. 102 W to Rt. 7; Left onto Rt. 7 south to Rt. 23; Left at traffic light onto Rt. 23 east to ski area entrance about 1.3 miles on right. Hartford 1 hour (51 mi) Rt. 44 W to Canaan, CT; north on Rt. 7 into MA where it merges with Rt. 23 as you go through the town of Great Barrington; Continue on Rt. 7N & 23E at traffic light to cross the metal bridge. Just pass the Sunoco station veer right at traffic light onto Rt. 23 east to ski area entrance about 1.3 miles on right. Danbury 1 hour, 15 min. (66 mi) Rt. 7N into MA where it merges with Rt. 23 as you go through the town of Great Barrington; Continue on Rt. 7N & 23E at traffic light to cross the metal bridge. Just pass the Sunoco station veer right at traffic light onto Rt. 23 east to ski area entrance about 1.3 miles on right. New Haven 1 hour, 45 min. (83 mi) 34 west to Rt. 8; Take rt. 8 north to Rt. 44 in Winsted, CT; West on Rt. 44 to Rt. 7 north; follow Rt. 7N into MA where it merges with Rt. 23 as you go through the town of Great Barrington; Continue on Rt. 7N & 23E at traffic light to cross the metal bridge. Just pass the Sunoco station veer right at traffic light onto Rt. 23 east to ski area entrance about 1.3 miles on right. New York City 2-1/2 hours (128 mi from Manhattan) Taconic State Parkway north to Claverack, NY / Rt. 23 Exit; Take Rt. 23 East through the towns of Hillsdale, NY then Egremont, MA and then through Great Barrington, MA. Continue on Rt. 7N & 23E at traffic light to cross the metal bridge. Just pass the Sunoco station veer right at traffic light onto Rt. 23 east to ski area entrance about 1.3 miles on right. Long Island 2-1/2 hours (113 mi from the Whitestone) Cross Whitestone bridge; Rt. 678 N. to Hutchinsin River Parkway, to Rt. 684 N to to Brewster where you'll pickup Rt. 22 N to Rt. 23 E stay on Rt. 23 E as you pass from NY into the state of MA. Continue on 23 E through the towns of Egremont, MA and then Great Barrington, MA to the ski area entrance on the right about 3 miles past the town of Great Barrington.

title: QuadCross 2014
course:
Start off in the field, run up around the pavilion twist and turn through the open trees, sand pit, off into the woods
couple of short steep climbs back down to the rifle range, over the barriers, around the field and do it again
directions:
Head north on I-95 N toward Exit 29A

Take exit 29B to merge onto MA-2 W toward Acton/Fitchburg
7.2 mi

Slight left onto MA-62 W/Main St
 Continue to follow MA-62 W
4.2 mi

Turn left onto Waltham St
0.5 mi

Turn left onto Old Mill Rd
 Destination will be on the left

title: Northeastern's Wild Western Mass MTB Weekend
Freetown 50
description:
The Freetown 50 is a unique and challenging mountain bike race featuring 50 miles of challenging technical terrain and big prizes in Freetown, MA.  There is also a 25 mile race available and an 11 mile race as well.  This event is presented by Spark Bike Run Sports in an effort to keep New England mountain bike racing alive in the fall season.  It began as a quest to bring back the Big Bang, a race that was known purely for how hard it was.  What it has evolved into is the kind of race that mountain bikers travel across the country for, except it’s right in our own backyard.  With outstanding support from our sponsors we deliver one of the best organized races with prizes and support like you’ve never seen.

If you’re looking for a long mountain bike race that will challenge your endurance as well as your technical skills then you’ve come to the right place.  Freetown/Fall River State Forest is known for an abundance of rocks.  Big rocks, small rocks, medium rocks, there’s plenty to go around (and over).  This race will test your endurance and your mountain biking skills and when the Freetown 50 spits you out across the finish line you’ll leave with a sense of accomplishment you could only get when you’ve been pushed past your limits.

If your limit is about half of 50 miles; you’re in luck too.  We have a 25 Mile Solo Event.  The Freetown 50 Solo prizes are much bigger, but they should be for doing twice the work.  We’ve set a total field limit of 400 riders for the event.

For the true beginner we have an 11 mile course that is only open to CAT 3 (Beginner) racers.  Be warned, it is only shorter, not easier.

This event features an outstanding course and rare pre/post-race amenities.  It will be a “can’t miss” event for mountain biking every year.
course:
Our course consists of a level mix of technical singletrack and fire roads with a very small amount of pavement.  GPS course plotting says it’s 24.89 miles per lap, a wheel sensor says 25.5.  Let’s just call it 25.  You will need real mountain bike skills to complete this race, but there are several flat sections that you can take a breather and regroup.

The Freetown 50 Solo Race requires each rider to complete 2 laps of the 25 mile course.

The Freetown 25 Solo Race requires each rider to complete 1 lap.

The Freetown 11 Solo Race requires beginner riders to complete 1 lap of a shorter course.
registration:
Registration is available on Bike Reg

Field Limit is 400
directions: Take exit 10 off of Route 24 and follow the signs to Freetown/Fall River State Forest

title: Bike Fest 2014 Tour of the Valley
description:
Come out to enjoy the stunning fall foliage, dairy farms, and quaint villages of the Pioneer Valley, then stay for the gourmet food, beer, live music and entertainment. BikeFest is the most fun you can have on or off a bike!

Tour of the Valley entrance fee includes fully supported ride with SAG, well-stocked rest stops, a post-ride gourmet BBQ lunch buffet with local craft beers, entertainment featuring the music  of The Art Steele Band, a pro BMX stunt show from Team East and other surprises.  High quality, advertising-free T-Shirts and Water Bottles are available for purchase while supplies last.
course:
BikeFest Tour of the Valley features FIVE, fully supported rides for cyclists of all ages and abilities:
Century - 104M
Metric Century - 72M
Orchard Ride - 43M
Steph's Farm Ride - 25M
Family Ride - 8M 
http://bikefest.nohobikeclub.org/bikefest-rides/
registration:
Registration opens at 6:30am and ends at 11:30 am.  Century leaves at 7:00am, Metric Century at 8:30 am, Orchard ride at 10am, and Farm ride at 10:45 am and Family ride at 11:30 a.m.  Riders needing more time can depart as early as 6:30 after checking in at registration.
https://www.bikereg.com/bikefest-tour-of-the-valley
notes: The day is about enjoying the ride, not finishing first.
directions: All rides start and end at the Dow Pavilion in Look Park, Northampton, MA.
